questions.question: How do Mr. Easton and Miss Fairhill come into contact with each other?

choices.answer: a.     He plans to meet her on a bus.
a.     He accidently runs in to her in a train station.
a.     He purposefully sits in front of her.
a.     He unexpectedly sits in frontof her on a train.

choices.answer: To prove that he was in charge.
To keep Mr. Easton from being embarrassed

questions.question: Describe Miss Fairhill

questions.question: How does the passenger figure out who the criminal is?

choices.answer: He pays attention to what the men say to each other.
He pays attention to where the men are sitting.
He pays attention to which hand is handcuffed on each man.

questions.question: Which line supports that Miss Fairchild may have been romantically involved with Mr. Easton at one point in their lives?

choices.answer: "Would you ask the marshall to speak a word for me when we get to the pen."
"The ambassador... doesn't call anymore. He needn't ever have done so."
"Not soon, I think, said Easton. My butterfly days are over, I fear."
"The bound travelers rose to their feet, Easton with the same slow smile.."

questions.question: What point of view is this story written in?

choices.answer: third person-limited -follows the thoughts and actions of Mr. Easton.
third person-limited- only follow the the actions of  Miss Fairchild
3rd -omniscient - narrator knows all & limits the actions to certain char.

questions.question: Which of the following show how the setting affects the main characters in this story?

choices.answer: They are put into an awkward position since they must face each other.
The awkwardness of facing each other makes the marshal to help the criminal
Both triangle and diamond are correct
None of the answers are correct.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the true marshal in this story?
Which is not a theme for "Hearts and Hands"?

choices.answer: People are not always who you think they are.
Some people help others out b/c they are human beings & share feelings.
Showing kindness and compassion can mean a lot to someone in need.
You never know who you will meet by traveling on a train.

questions.question: The glum-faced man was watching the girl's countenance with veiled glances from his keen eyes.What was the man watching?
The glum-faced man was watching the girl's face with veiled glances from his keen, shrewd eyes. What does veiled mean?
The man's eyes are described as keen and shrewd. What does this mean?

choices.answer: His eyes are tired and droopy.
His eyes are observant and take in everything that happens.
His eyes are wild and intent.
His eyes are watchful yet not truly paying attention.

questions.question: Which word best describes the situation that plays out in the story?
What is the meaning of Hearts in the title "Hearts and Hands"?

choices.answer: It refers Miss Fairchild liking Mr. Easton enough to talk about going West.
The marshal's compassionate for Mr. E to lie to save him from embarassment.
Both triangle and diamond are correct.

questions.question: What is the meaning of "Hands" in "Hearts and Hands"?

choices.answer: Mr. Easton being handcuffed to the marshal.
The marshal hand being forced to do his duty.
The twist - the man never saw an officer handcuff a prisoner to right hand.

questions.question: The influx of people moved quickly to the exit. What does influx mean in the sentence?
I gave her a very frank answer to the question although she seemed not to like it. What does frank mean?

choices.answer: a feeling of great pain or sadness
something that's made to look like the real thing but is fake.

questions.question: I was bewildered with a difficult algebra question. What does bewildered mean?

choices.answer: senior official who lives in a foreign country & represents his/her country

questions.question: The cook knew that the sauce wasn't quite right, mainly because of his keen sense of smell. What does keen mean?

questions.question: The shrewd boy quickly answered the difficult question. What does shrewd mean?
